meanings.definition: Of or relating to the eyes.
meanings.sent1: The doctor used an ocular tool to examine my eyes.
meanings.sent2: Her ocular health was important to her overall well-being.
meanings.sent3: The cat's ocular focus on the moving toy was amusing to watch.
meanings.sent4: The ocular beauty of the sunset painted the sky in vibrant colors.
meanings.sent5: The ocular image of the rainbow after the rainstorm was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: A pair of lenses used for viewing distant objects.
meanings.sent1: I used my oculars to see the birds in the faraway tree.
meanings.sent2: The tourist brought their oculars to observe the mountain scenery.
meanings.sent3: The detective's oculars helped him spot the hidden clue.
meanings.sent4: Through his oculars, the astronomer saw the distant galaxy clearly.
meanings.sent5: The pirate's oculars aided him in spotting land on the horizon.

meanings.definition: A device for viewing objects at a distance, such as binoculars.
meanings.sent1: The explorer carried his oculars to see the wildlife from afar.
meanings.sent2: She adjusted the focus on her oculars to get a clearer view.
meanings.sent3: The spy used his oculars to keep an eye on the target.
meanings.sent4: With his oculars, the birdwatcher spotted a rare species in the trees.
meanings.sent5: The photographer's oculars helped capture detailed shots of the landscape.
